data.title: European Heraldry :: Sweden
data.text:
KINGDOM OF SWEDEN

The House of Bjälbo or the House of Folkung

1250-1389

Magnus Birgersson (1240–1290), usually called Magnus Ladulås

Magnus Birgersson (1240–1290), usually called Magnus Ladulås, King of Sweden from 1275 until his death in 1290.

Magnus IV (1316 –1374)

Magnus IV (1316 –1374) King of Sweden (including Finland) from 1319 to 1364, King of Norway as Magnus VII (including Iceland and Greenland) from 1319 to 1343, and ruler of Scania from 1332 to 1360.

House of Mecklenburg 1364-1389

Albert (c. 1338 – 1412)

Albert (c. 1338 – 1412) King of Sweden from 1364 to 1389 and Duke of Mecklenburg-Schwerin from 1384 to 1412 as Albert III.

Kalmar Union (1389-1521)

It was a personal union that joined under a single monarch the three kingdoms of Denmark, Sweden (then including Finland), and Norway.

House of Pomerania (1397–1439)

Eric VII of Pomerania (1382 – 1459)

Eric VII of Pomerania (1382 – 1459) King of Norway (1389–1442), elected King of Denmark (1396–1439), and of Sweden (1396–1439). Married Philippa of England (1394 – 1430) daughter of King Henry IV of England.

House of Palatinate-Neumarkt (1440–1448)

Christopher III of Bavaria (1416- 1448)

Christopher III of Bavaria (1416- 1448) Union King of Denmark (1440-1448), Sweden (1441-1448) and Norway (1442-1448). Married Dorothea of Brandenburg (1431 – 1495) daughter of John, Margrave of Brandenburg-Kulmbach.

House of Bonde (1448 – 1457, 1464 – 1465, 1467 -1470)

Charles II of Sweden and Charles I of Norway (1408 – 1470)

Charles II of Sweden and Charles I of Norway (1408 – 1470) King of Sweden (1448 – 1457, 1464 – 1465, 1467 -1470) King of Norway (1449 – 1450). Born Charles Knutsson Bonde.

House of Oldenburg (1457–1521)

Christian I (1426–1481)

Christian I (1426–1481) Union King of Denmark (1448 – 1481), Norway (1450-1481) and Sweden (1457–1464). Duke of Schleswig and Holstein 1460-81. ). Married Dorothea of Brandenburg (1431 – 1495) daughter of John, Margrave of Brandenburg-Kulmbach. Founder of The Order of the Elephant.

John II (1455 – 1513)

John (1455 – 1513) King of Denmark (1481–1513), Norway (1483–1513) and as John II Sweden (1497–1501). Also Duke of Schleswig and Holstein (1482–1513) in joint rule with his brother Frederick. Married Christina of Saxony (1461 – 1521) daughter of Ernest, Elector of Saxony.

Christian II (1481 –1559)

Christian II (1481 –1559) King of Denmark and Norway (1513 –1523) Sweden (1520 –1521). Also Duke of Schleswig and Holstein (1513 –1523) in joint rule with his uncle Frederick. Married Isabella of Austria (1501 – 1526) Archduchess of Austria and Infanta of Castile and Aragon, daughter of King Philip I and Queen Joanna of Castile.

House of Vasa 1523-1654

Kings of Sweden 1523-1654

Gustav I (1496 – 1560)

Gustav I (1496 – 1560) King of Sweden from 1523. Born Gustav Eriksson of the Vasa noble family and later known as Gustav Vasa. Married firstly Catherine of Saxe-Lauenburg (1513 – 1535) daughter of Magnus I, Duke of Saxe-Lauenburg, secondly Margaret Leijonhufvud (1516 – 1551) née Margareta Eriksdotter, daughter of Erik Abrahamsson Leijonhufvud and thirdly Catherine Stenbock (1535 – 1621) daughter of Riksråd Gustaf Olofsson Stenbock.

Eric XIV (1533 –1577)

Eric XIV (1533 –1577) King of Sweden from 1560 until he was deposed in 1568. Married Karin Månsdotter (1550 – 1612). Founder of The Order of the Saviour in 1561.

John III (1537 – 1592)

John III (1537 – 1592) King of Sweden from 1568. Married firstly Catherine Jagiellon (1526 – 1583) daughter of Sigismund I the Old, King of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth and secondly (1568 – 1597) Gunilla Johansdotter Bielke daughter of Johan Axelsson Bielke. Founder of The Order of the Lamb of God (Agnus Dei) in 1569.

Sigismund III Vasa (1566 – 1632)

Sigismund III Vasa (1566 – 1632) King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania from 1587 to 1632, and King of Sweden from 1592 until he was deposed in 1599. Married firstly Anne of Austria (1573 – 1598) daughter of Charles II Francis of Austria, Archduke of Inner Austria and secondly Constance of Austria (1588 –1631) daughter of Charles II Francis of Austria, Archduke of Inner Austria (she married the widower of her older sister).

Charles IX (1550 – 1611)

Charles IX (1550 – 1611) King of Sweden from 1604. Married firstly Maria of the Palatinate (1561 – 1589) Duchess of Södermanland daughter of Louis VI, Elector Palatine and secondly Christina of Holstein-Gottorp (1573– 1625) daughter of Adolf, Duke of Holstein-Gottorp. Founder of The Royal Order of Jehova in 1606.

Gustav II Adolf (Gustavus Adolphus) (1594 – 1632)

Gustav II Adolf (Gustavus Adolphus) (1594 – 1632) King of Sweden. Married Maria Eleonora of Brandenburg (1599 – 1655) daughter of John Sigismund, Elector of Brandenburg.

Christina (1626 – 1689)

Christina (1626 – 1689) Queen of Sweden from 1633 to 1654. Founder of The Order of Amarante in 1653.

Gustav Eriksson Vasa, Prince of Sweden (1568 – 1607)

Gustav Eriksson Vasa, Prince of Sweden (1568 – 1607) son of Eric XIV and Karin Månsdotter, born before their marriage.

Kings of Poland and Grand Dukes of Lithuania 1587- 1668

Sigismund III Vasa (1566 – 1632)

Sigismund III Vasa (1566 – 1632) King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania from 1587 to 1632, and King of Sweden from 1592 until he was deposed in 1599. Married firstly Anne of Austria (1573 – 1598) daughter of Charles II Francis of Austria, Archduke of Inner Austria and secondly Constance of Austria (1588 –1631) daughter of Charles II Francis of Austria, Archduke of Inner Austria (married the widower of her older sister).

Władysław IV (1595 –1648)

Władysław IV (1595 –1648) King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania. Elected Tsar of Russia in 1610, but did not assume the Russian throne. Married firstly Archduchess Cecilia Renata of Austria (1611 – 1644) daughter of Ferdinand II, Holy Roman Emperor and secondly Marie Louise Gonzaga (1611 – 1667) daughter of Charles I, Duke of Mantua.

John II Casimir (1609 –1668)

John II Casimir (1609 –1668) King of Poland and Grand Duke of Lithuania. Married firstly his brother’s widow Marie Louise Gonzaga (1611 – 1667) daughter of Charles I, Duke of Mantua and secondly married morganatically Claudine Françoise Mignot (1624 – 1711)

House of Palatinate-Zweibrücken or Wittelsbach Palatinate-Zweibrücken-Kleeburg (1654-1720)

Charles X Gustav (1622 – 1660)

Charles X Gustav (1622 – 1660) Count Palatine of Kleeburg and King of Sweden from 1654, son of John Casimir, Count Palatine of Zweibrücken-Kleeburg and Catherine of Sweden, daughter of Charles IX). Married Hedwig Eleonora of Holstein-Gottorp (1636 – 1715) daughter of Frederick III, Duke of Holstein-Gottorp. Founder of The Order of Jesus in 1656.

Charles XI (1655–1697)

Charles XI (1655–1697) King of Sweden and Duke of Zweibrücken. Married Ulrika Eleonora of Denmark (1656 – 1693) daughter of Frederick III, King of Denmark.

Charles XII (1682 –1718)

Charles XII (1682 –1718) King of Sweden and Duke of Zweibrücken.

Ulrika Eleonora (1688 – 1741)

Ulrika Eleonora (1688 – 1741) Queen regnant of Sweden from 1718 to 1720. Married Frederick I (1676 – 1751) Landgrave of Hesse-Kassel and resigned in his favour.

House of Hesse (1720-1751)

Frederick I (1676 – 1751)

Frederick I (1676 – 1751) Prince consort of Sweden from 1718 to 1720 and King of Sweden from 1720 also Landgrave of Hesse-Kassel from 1730. Married Ulrika Eleonora (1688 – 1741) Queen regnant of Sweden. Founder of the Order of the Seraphim and the Order of the Sword and the Order of the Polar Star in 1748.

House of Holstein-Gottorp (1751-1818)

Adolf Frederick (1710 – 1771)

Adolf Frederick (1710 – 1771) Prince of Holstein-Gottorp-Eutin, Prince-Bishop of Lübeck (1727–1750) and King of Sweden from 1751. Married Louisa Ulrika of Prussia (1720 – 1782) daughter of Frederick William I, King in Prussia.

Gustav III (1746 – 1792)

Gustav III (1746 – 1792) King of Sweden. Married Sophia Magdalena of Denmark (1746 – 1813) daughter of Frederick V, King of Denmark. Founder of The Royal Order of Vasa in 1772.

Gustav IV Adolf (1778 – 1837)

Gustav IV Adolf (1778 – 1837) King of Sweden from 1792 until his abdication in 1809. Married Friederike "Frederica" Dorothea Wilhelmina of Baden (1781 – 1826) daughter of Karl Ludwig, Hereditary Prince of Baden.

Charles XIII & II (1748 - 1818)

Charles XIII & II (1748 - 1818) King of Sweden (as Charles XIII) from 1809 and King of Norway (as Charles II) from 1814. Married Hedwig Elisabeth Charlotte of Holstein-Gottorp (1759 – 1818) daughter of Frederick August I, Duke of Holstein-Gottorp.

Prince Gustav Vasa, Count Itterburg (1799 – 1877)

Prince Gustav Vasa, Count Itterburg (1799 – 1877) born Crown Prince of Sweden and later called Gustaf Gustafsson von Holstein-Gottorp, Prince of Vasa. Son of the deposed Gustav IV Adolf. Married Princess Louise Amelie Stephanie of Baden (1811 – 1854) daughter of Charles, Grand Duke of Baden.

Princess-Abbess of Quedlinburg

Princess Sophia Albertina of Sweden (1753 – 1829) Princess-Abbess of Quedlinburg, daughter of Adolf Frederick (1710 – 1771) King of Sweden.

House of Bernadotte (1818 to present)

Sovereign Prince of Pontecorvo

Charles XIV & III (1763–1844)

Charles XIV & III (1763–1844) King of Sweden (Charles XIV John) and King of Norway (Charles III John III) from 1818. Born Jean-Baptiste Bernadotte, later renamed Jean-Baptiste Jules Bernadotte. Sovereign Prince of Pontecorvo from 1806 until 1810. Married Bernardine Eugénie Désirée Clary (1777 – 1860) daughter of François Clary.

Oscar I (1799 – 1859)

Oscar I (1799 – 1859) King of Sweden and Norway, born Joseph François Oscar Bernadotte. Married Joséphine of Leuchtenberg or Joséphine de Beauharnais (1807 - 1876) daughter of Eugène de Beauharnais, Duke of Leuchtenberg. Founder of The Royal Norwegian Order of Saint Olav in 1847.

Charles XV & IV (1826 – 1872)

Charles XV & IV (1826 – 1872) King of Sweden (Charles XV) and Norway (Charles IV). Married Louise of the Netherlands (1828 – 1871) daughter of Prince Frederick of the Netherlands, Prince of Orange-Nassau.

Oscar II (1829 – 1907)

Oscar II (1829 – 1907) King of Sweden and King of Norway from 1872 until 1905. Married Sophia of Nassau (1836 – 1913) daughter of Wilhelm, Duke of Nassau.

Gustaf V (1858 – 1950)

Gustaf V (1858 – 1950) King of Sweden. Married Victoria of Baden (1862 – 1930) daughter of Grand Frederick I, Duke of Baden.

Gustaf VI Adolf (1882 – 1973)

Gustaf VI Adolf (1882 – 1973) King of Sweden. Married firstly Princess Margaret of Connaught (1882 – 1920) Crown Princess of Sweden and Duchess of Scania daughter of Prince Arthur of Great Britain and Ireland, Duke of Connaught and Strathearn and secondly Princess Louise of Battenberg (1889 –1965) daughter of Prince Louis of Battenberg.

Carl XVI Gustaf (born 1946)

Carl XVI Gustaf (born 1946) King of Sweden. Married Silvia Renate Sommerlath (born 1943) daughter of Walther Sommerlath.
